I'm new to JUnit, so I'm probably missing something obvious, but does
anyon=
e know how to get @Ignore occurrences to get reported? 

For example, given=
 the following source code:

T.java: the implementation class to be tested
=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D
public clas=
s T {
    public static int positive() { return 1; }
    public static int =
negative() { return -1; }
    public static int zero()     { return 0; }
}
=
  
TTest.java: the test class
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D
import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.I=
gnore;
import static org.junit.Assert.*;

public class TTest {
    @Test 
 =
   public void positive() { 
       assertTrue( "Positive", (T.positive() >=
 0) ); 
    }
    @Test 
    public void testNegative() { 
       assertTru=
e( "Negative", (T.negative() < 0) ); 
    }
    @Ignore("Not ready, yet") 
=
    public void testZero() { 
        assertTrue( "Zero", (T.zero() =3D=3D =
0) ); 
    }
}

I get the following output from ant:

$ ant unittest
Buildf=
ile: build.xml

compile:

compile-tests:
    [javac] Compiling 1 source fil=
e to test-classes

unittest:
    [junit] Running TTest
    [junit] Tests ru=
n: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.083 sec
[junitreport] Process=
ing TESTS-TestSuites.xml to /tmp/null1495231817
[junitreport] Loading style=
sheet
jar:file:/usr/share/ant/lib/ant-junit.jar!/org/apache/tools/ant/taskd=
efs/optional/junit/xsl/junit-frames.xsl
[junitreport] Transform time: 682ms=

[junitreport] Deleting: /tmp/null1495231817

... and the following output from JUnit itself ...

$ java -ea -=
cp /usr/share/java/junit4.jar:classes:test-classes
org.junit.runner.JUnitCo=
re TTest
JUnit version 4.3.1
..
Time: 0.011

OK (2 tests)

In both cases, a=
bove (and the generated HTML reports from ant),
there's no notification tha=
t we ignored any tests. What am I missing,
here? The JavaDoc for @Ignore se=
emed to imply that this type of info
should be reported (see http://junit.o=
rg/apidocs/org/junit/Ignore.html):
"... Native JUnit 4 test runners should =
report the number of ignored
tests along with the number of tests that ran =
and the number of tests
that failed."

My goal was to use @Ignore to "intel=
ligently comment" out some tests.
For example, something like:

   @Ignore =
("Tests bug #4321 when fixed")

Ideally, I'd like to see that tests were ig=
nored and be able to
extract the annotation string to why they were ignored=
. 

Bob
